org.ojai.util

Class Values

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ojai.util.Values

  • @API.Public
public class Values
extends Object
    A helper class that provides convenience methods to operate on a Value.

      • parseDate

        public static Date parseDate(String date)
        Converts a string in ISO-8601 date format to a Date value. This method assumes that the specified date string is in GMT, unlike Date.valueOf(String), which uses the current timezone.
        Parameters:
        date - a String object representing a date in in the format "yyyy-mm-dd"
        Returns:
        A java.sql.Date object representing the given date
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the date given is not in the ISO-8601 date format (yyyy-mm-dd)

      • toDateStr

        public static String toDateStr(Date date)
        Returns the JDBC string representation ("yyyy-mm-dd") of the specified Date.
        Parameters:
        date - the Date value to stringify.
        Returns:
        The formatted date string.

      • parseTime

        public static Time parseTime(String time)
        Converts a string in ISO-8601 time format to a Time value. This assumes that the specified time string is in GMT, unlike Time.valueOf(String), which uses current timezone.
        Parameters:
        time - a String object representing a time in in the format "HH:mm", "HH:mm:ss" or "HH:mm:ss.SSS"
        Returns:
        A java.sql.Time object representing the given time
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the time given is not in the ISO-8601 date format "HH:mm:ss" or "HH:mm:ss.SSS"

      • toTimeStr

        public static String toTimeStr(Time time)
        Returns the JDBC string representation ("HH:mm:ss") of the specified Time.
        Parameters:
        time - the Time value to stringify
        Returns:
        The formatted time string

      • parseTimestamp

        public static Timestamp parseTimestamp(String timestampe)
        Converts a string in ISO-8601 time format to a Time value. This assumes that the specified time string is in GMT, unlike Timestamp.valueOf(String), which uses current timezone.
        Parameters:
        timestampe - a String object representing a timestamp in in the format "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX"
        Returns:
        A java.sql.Timestampe object representing the given timestamp
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the time given is not in the ISO-8601 timestamp format "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSSXXX".

      • toTimestampString

        public static String toTimestampString(Timestamp timeStamp)

      • asJsonString

        public static String asJsonString(Value value)
        Converts a Value to its extended JSON representation.

        The 7 intrinsic types,  null, boolean, string, long, double, array, and map , are represented in regular JSON. The extended types are converted to a singleton map with the type tag name as the key and the value of the given Value as its value. The following sample illustrates the string representation of the various types. 
         {
   "map": {
     "null": null,
     "boolean" : true,
     "string": "eureka",
     "byte" : {"$numberLong": 127},
     "short": {"$numberLong": 32767},
     "int": {"$numberLong": 2147483647},
     "long": {"$numberLong":9223372036854775807},
     "float" : 3.4028235E38,
     "double" : 1.7976931348623157e308,
     "decimal": {"$decimal": "12345678901234567890189012345678901.23456789"},
     "date": {"$dateDay": "<yyyy-mm-dd>"},
     "time" : {"$time" : "<HH:mm:ss[.sss]>"},
     "timestamp" : {"$date" : "<yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSXXX>"},
     "interval" : {"$interval" : <number_of_millisecods>},
     "binary" : {"$binary" : "<base64_encoded_binary_value>"},
     "array" : [42, "open sesame", 3.14, {"$dateDay": "2015-01-21"}]
   }
 }
        Parameters:
        value - a Value that should be converted to JSON string
        Returns:
        The extended JSON representation of the given value

        public static void setTimeZone(TimeZone tz)
